p: ERT is contrary to ECT applied when the continuous phase is conducting [ 56]. It can be a challenge that the continuous phase needs to be conducting, since the phases can vary e.g., during a slug cycle. During a slug cycle the gas volume fraction (GVF) can vary from 0â€“100% and the continuous phase is hereby not guaranteed to be conducting at all times. ERT has also been widely described and investigated [ 84, 85, 86, 87, 88]. The electrodes of an ERT sensor are located in direct contact with the flow inside the pipe.
